intro: Jasione montana f. jankae, commonly known as the Jankae's mountain jasmine, is a rare and lesser-known botanical variant of the mountain jasmine species. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to specific alpine regions in Central Europe. The plant features small, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center, blooming in late summer. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. This subspecies is noted for its ecological significance in high-altitude ecosystems, though it remains under-studied in botanical research.
